intro: Spergularia larranagae, commonly known as the Larranaga's sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. It is typically found in sandy or calcareous soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Spergularia larranagae is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
